chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th) and OWI 5th. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th) and the other charge, OWI 5th was dismissed by the court.

  • William E Garner was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Set up payment plan with the agent within 30 days.
With credit for any administrative suspension.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).    Court finds defendant eligible for reduced cost on Ignition Interlock Device due to hardship.

miscConds.notes: Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  $250 represents DNA surcharge.  $32.50 represents Blood Draw Test fee..
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to drive with any alcohol in system.  Not to drive any vehicle without Ignition Interlock Device.

timeConds.notes: Electronic monitoring authorized if qualifies.  May serve in Eau Claire County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Request for modification in sentence and Order - Denied (faxed to Jail 05/18/2016)

Defendant William E Garner in court.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge states that there are consequences for his actions.  Judge told him that the 300 hours community service does not substitute for jail time.  ADA Broeren states his opinion.  Defendant states he is not able to get promotion at work due to not being able to be available 24/7.  Defendant states there are limitations on his electronic monitoring.  Judge wants defendant to check with jail about possible change in hours for electronic monitor.  Judge denying motion at this time but will reserve defendant's right to bring up again for possible change in electronic monitoring.  Judge will not reduce jail sentence.
Request for modification in sentence and Order - Denied.
Hearing on May 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
